e1ae0304-0697-4a94-93d2-926882bfe53c.notes: Do not suffer the normal -3 penalty for unfamiliarity

d19d450e-2ba8-4d07-8c02-2ace14a540b7.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate (but not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

baf307c2-8d76-4d6a-96a0-24b516f1ae0a.notes: Usable once per hour of play

5637d1e6-6c57-4653-9e74-007c3c5de205.name: Off-the-Shelf Looks
5637d1e6-6c57-4653-9e74-007c3c5de205.notes: Halves the usual reaction bonus - adjust manually

features.situation: from those attracted to members of your sex, +2 from everyone else. Exception: Members of the same sex with reason to dislike you (more than -4 in reaction penalties regardless of bonuses) resent your good looks and react at -2 instead.

to someone else's reaction bonus from others when you put together their outfit

b3babe0d-5d89-4821-aa81-a3fea357b407.name: Indomitable
b3babe0d-5d89-4821-aa81-a3fea357b407.notes: Impossible to influence through ordinary words or actions

features.situation: From con artists, politicians, salesmen, etc. – but only if you aren’t trying to manipulate them.

8da48941-5983-49e3-b6c0-0294beee4383.name: Social Chameleon
8da48941-5983-49e3-b6c0-0294beee4383.notes: Exempt from reaction penalties due to differences in Rank or Status

features.situation: from those who demand respect in situations where there would be no penalties due to differences in Rank or Status
from others who can hear your voice

f19a2509-e98f-46ea-a6de-1cc0583c2fe7.name: 10 Points chosen from any amount of

f1cd6770-d165-44c7-b1f1-262145ecfd17.name: Cultural Familiarity (@Culture@)
f1cd6770-d165-44c7-b1f1-262145ecfd17.notes: Do not suffer the normal -3 penalty for unfamiliarity

f22c6c34-61f5-43cb-a3b7-1fc9cfd1fe64.name: Agoraphobia (Open Spaces)
f22c6c34-61f5-43cb-a3b7-1fc9cfd1fe64.notes: You are uncomfortable whenever you are outside, and actually become frightened when there are no walls within 50 feet.

38d5cb8d-e582-46e2-8dc5-c4ca353e14ea.name: Code of Honor (Mercanary's)
38d5cb8d-e582-46e2-8dc5-c4ca353e14ea.notes: A merc should look out for his buddies, take care of his gear, and fight for the honor of the unit. Obey the rule's of engagement. Don't poach on another unit's contract. Do the job you're hired for.

c5867a65-c617-4146-8c48-ba9ce53f1baa.name: Code of Honor (Pirate's)
c5867a65-c617-4146-8c48-ba9ce53f1baa.notes: Always avenge an insult, regardless of the danger; your buddy’s foe is your own; never attack a fellow crewman or buddy except in a fair, open duel.

671583e9-236e-42e3-81f5-e83407aac6f3.name: Code of Honor (Soldier's)
671583e9-236e-42e3-81f5-e83407aac6f3.notes: An officer should be tough but fair, lead from the front, and look out for his men; an enlisted man should look out for his buddies and take care of his kit. Every soldier should be willing to fight and die for the honor of his unit, service, and country; follow orders; obey the “rules of war”; treat an honorable enemy with respect (a dishonorable enemy deserves a bullet); and wear the uniform with pride.

features.situation: or worse from sober-minded citizens (GM discretion)

72fba2c9-a0df-4205-92c1-0739b5337c52.name: Demophobia (Crowds)
72fba2c9-a0df-4205-92c1-0739b5337c52.notes: Any group of over a dozen people sets off this fear unless they are all well known to you. The self-control roll is at -1 for over 25 people, -2 for a crowd of 100 or more, -3 for 1,000, -4 for 10,000, and so on.

d52ba13f-e939-46e0-ba76-eda7375d0098.name: Honesty
d52ba13f-e939-46e0-ba76-eda7375d0098.notes: Make a self-control roll when faced with the “need” to break unreasonable laws; if you fail, you must obey the law, whatever the consequences. If you manage to resist your urges and break the law, make a second self-control roll afterward. If you fail, you must turn yourself in to the authorities!

features.situation: from victims of your intolerance (may be as much as -5, at GM's discretion)

ca2faa62-b79c-44db-9b76-597fb43733c9.name: Lecherousness
ca2faa62-b79c-44db-9b76-597fb43733c9.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you have more than the briefest contact with an appealing member of the sex you find attractive, at -5 if this person is Handsome/Beautiful, or at -10 if Very Handsome/Very Beautiful. If you fail, you must make a “pass” using whatever wiles and skills you can bring to bear.

04a1314a-ee1c-4a91-ad66-66024aeea0bb.name: Pacifism: Cannot Harm Innocents
04a1314a-ee1c-4a91-ad66-66024aeea0bb.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may only use deadly force on a foe that is attempting to do you serious harm. Capture is not “serious harm” unless you are already under penalty of death or have a Code of Honor that would require suicide if captured. You never intentionally do anything that causes, or even threatens to cause, injury to the uninvolved – particularly if they are “ordinary folks.”

ffacaacc-4375-4584-a225-63e1c55147a4.name: Pacifism: Reluctant Killer
ffacaacc-4375-4584-a225-63e1c55147a4.notes: You are psychologically unprepared to kill people. Whenever you make a deadly attack (e.g., with a knife or a gun) against an obvious person whose face is visible to you, you are at -4 to hit and may not Aim. If you cannot see the foe’s face (due to a mask, darkness, or distance, or because you attacked from behind), the penalty is only -2, save in close combat. You have no penalty to attack a vehicle (even an occupied one), an opponent you do not believe is a person (including things with Horrific or Monstrous appearance), or a target you can’t actually see (e.g., a set of map coordinates or a blip on a radar screen). If you kill a recognizable person, the effect on you is the same as for Pacifism: Cannot Kill. You have no problem with your allies killing; you may even supply ammo, loaded weapons, and encouragement! You just can’t do the killing yourself.

60e29c8a-59dd-4692-a64b-15eb15383a3f.name: Pacifism: Self-Defense Only
60e29c8a-59dd-4692-a64b-15eb15383a3f.notes: You only fight to defend yourself or those in your care, using only as much force as necessary (no pre-emptive strikes allowed!). You must do your best to discourage others from starting fights.

features.situation: from non-criminals who learn of your Criminal Record. Police, judges, vigilantes, and other law-and-order types react at -2

e2ceac82-b60f-4e32-9c5f-31d62aa03042.name: Gluttony
e2ceac82-b60f-4e32-9c5f-31d62aa03042.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with a tempting morsel or good wine that, for some reason, you should resist. If you fail, you partake – regardless of the consequences.

78087a60-ad77-45f7-a262-eec2ae827dbf.name: Greed
78087a60-ad77-45f7-a262-eec2ae827dbf.notes: Make a self-control roll any time riches are offered – as payment for fair work, gains from adventure, spoils of crime, or just bait. If you fail, you do whatever it takes to get the payoff.

8f96f072-f9b0-4856-be18-40d5026e7fc7.name: Kleptomania
8f96f072-f9b0-4856-be18-40d5026e7fc7.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you are presented with a chance to steal, at up to -3 if the item is especially interesting to you (not necessarily valuable, unless you are poor or have Greed). If you fail, you must try to steal it. You may keep or sell stolen items, but you may not return or discard them.

7b92ac1d-599d-431d-9869-0d746bd0786a.name: Miserliness
7b92ac1d-599d-431d-9869-0d746bd0786a.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you are called on to spend money. If the expenditure is large, this roll may be at -5 or worse (GM’s decision). If you fail, you refuse to spend the money.

8b5b1381-b382-43c2-a2a8-088f2f34f8ea.name: Mysophobia (Dirt)
8b5b1381-b382-43c2-a2a8-088f2f34f8ea.notes: You are deathly afraid of infection, or just of dirt and filth. Make a self-control roll when you must do something that might get you dirty. Roll at -5 to eat any unaccustomed food. You should act as “finicky” as possible.

b9f50929-21d6-4ca1-b651-72c306c0b1e1.name: Post-Combat Shakes
b9f50929-21d6-4ca1-b651-72c306c0b1e1.notes: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.

cc44539a-8a85-41af-bd5a-b4fec8e8a9b9.name: Selfless
cc44539a-8a85-41af-bd5a-b4fec8e8a9b9.notes: You must make a self-control roll to put your needs – even survival – before those of someone else.

features.situation: From con artists, politicians, salesmen, etc. – but only if you aren’t trying to manipulate them.
From con artists, politicians, salesmen, etc. – but only if you aren’t trying to manipulate them.

f3b4d469-6593-4a6a-8f98-14fdc8b41bc4.name: Area Knowledge
f3b4d469-6593-4a6a-8f98-14fdc8b41bc4.notes: Location of the capitals of interplanetary states and the homeworlds of major races; general awareness of all major races; knowledge of individuals of Status 8; general understanding of relations between interplanetary states

c4e0ce30-8348-4fe6-9626-f31279d7f7cb.name: Area Knowledge
c4e0ce30-8348-4fe6-9626-f31279d7f7cb.notes: Location of major planets; familiarity with all known races (but not necessarily expertise); knowledge of people of Status 7+; general understanding of the economic and political situation

8eb776b1-2186-4b82-93e1-681eaef5e32b.name: Area Knowledge
8eb776b1-2186-4b82-93e1-681eaef5e32b.notes: Location of its major cities and important sites; awareness of its major customs, ethnic groups, and languages (but not necessarily expertise); names of folk of Status 7+; and a general understanding of the economic and political situation

732a983d-5090-4a07-b9e1-c5cdfb984eee.name: or from extra secondary skill options

d9aae41b-709a-4cfb-a5e0-184ebdfc48a0.name: Or spent on Languages or Cultural Familiarities
